instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message:
Working on a dead <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. After removing a shorted capacitor (<CAPACITOR>C7651</CAPACITOR>), I get <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> at 20V, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 12.3V, and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at 3.3V.

I tried a DFU firmware restore which showed an error the very end (“The System cannot be restored on this device.”), presumably because the machine cannot start up.

What can I troubleshoot to show why <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> fails to go to 12.6V?

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message:
There is a communication problem between T2 and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

If enters DFU, all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages should be present.
Check if all SSD voltages are there.

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message:
The following voltages are present for ca. 5 seconds, then go to 0 for 1 second, and pulsing so forth:

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL>: 1.2V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE: 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL>: 0.75V
PVDDCPUSRAMAWAKE: 0.8V
P1V1SLPS2R: 1.1V
P1V8SLPS2R: 1.8V
P1V8SLPS2R: 0.8V

The SSD voltages are:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 12.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>I2C_SSD_SCL</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
<SIGNAL>I2C_SSD_SDA</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
<SIGNAL>ISNS_SSDNAND_N</SIGNAL>: 12.3V
<SIGNAL>ISNS_SSDNAND_P</SIGNAL>: 12.3V
<SIGNAL>ISNS_SSDNAND_IOUT</SIGNAL>: 0.23V
<SIGNAL>P1V8_LX0_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>P0V9_LX0_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>P2V7_SW1_TPS62180_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 0V

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message:
Put some logic on your work.
I said all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltage have been confirmed; as you was able to see the machine in DFU mode!
However, is your choice, if you like to waste time checking them again.

You didn't check exact points expected for SSD voltage; but enough to see all missing.
Check diode mode to ground at L9020/30/80.

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message:
Diode mode (+ probe on ground) readings are:
L9020: 0.36
L9030: 0.35
L9080: 0.36

threads.title: 2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
2018 Pro board with PPBUS at 12.3V (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
threads.message: Just noticed that <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> gets extremely hot as soon as the charger is plugged in... I assume it's shorted. This component (<CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP>) isn't easy to find, so I'll order from China.
